text: The Act of Settlement is an Act of the Parliament of England. It passed in 1701. It settled the succession to the English and Irish crowns to only Protestants. More specifically, anyone who became a Roman Catholic, or who married one, was not able to inherit the throne. ==Related page== *Acts of Union 1707 == Notes == Category:1701 Category:18th century in the Kingdom of Great Britain Category:Acts of the Parliament of England Category:1700s in Europe
title: Act of Settlement 1701
